Retirement Savings Calculator

info
Current age is the age you are today. This is the starting point for calculating how many years you have left until retirement, an essential input for the retirement savings calculator to project your savings growth.
info
Retirement age is the age at which you plan to retire. This determines how many years you will be contributing to your savings and helps the retirement savings calculator estimate the total amount you need to save.
info
Current savings is the total amount of money you have already saved for retirement. This figure is crucial for the retirement savings calculator to project your future savings growth and retirement income.
$


info
Annual contribution is the amount of money you plan to save each year towards your retirement. This input helps the retirement savings calculator estimate the total amount you will save by the time you retire.
$
(Optional) info
Retirement duration is the number of years you expect to be retired. This helps the retirement savings calculator determine how long your savings need to last and the annual income you can withdraw.


(Optional) info
Post-retirement income is any income you expect to receive after retirement, such as a pension or part-time work. Including this helps the retirement savings calculator provide a more accurate projection of your financial needs.
$
(Optional) info
Desired annual retirement income is the amount of money you wish to have each year during retirement. This helps the retirement savings calculator determine how much you need to save to achieve your retirement goals.
$
(Optional) info
Inflation rate is the rate at which you expect the cost of living to increase each year. Including this helps the retirement savings calculator adjust your savings projections to account for rising expenses.
%
(Optional) info
Employer match is the percentage of your contributions that your employer will match. This can significantly boost your retirement savings, and including it helps the retirement savings calculator provide a more accurate projection.
%
(Optional) info
Tax rate is the percentage of your income that you will pay in taxes. This input helps the retirement savings calculator estimate your net retirement income and savings growth.
%

How to Use Monvvo Retirement Savings Calculator

  1. Enter Your Current Age.
    Provide your current age. This is the starting point for the retirement savings calculator to project your savings growth.
  2. Input Your Desired Retirement Age.
    Specify the age at which you plan to retire. This helps the retirement savings calculator determine the number of years you will be saving.
  3. Provide Your Current Savings.
    Enter the total amount of money you have already saved for retirement. This helps the retirement savings calculator project future growth.
  4. Specify Your Annual Contribution.
    Input the amount of money you plan to save each year. This is crucial for the retirement savings calculator to estimate your total savings.
  5. Estimate Your Retirement Duration.
    Specify the number of years you expect to be retired. This helps the retirement savings calculator determine how long your savings need to last.
  6. Add Post-Retirement Income.
    Include any expected income after retirement, such as pensions. This helps the retirement savings calculator adjust your savings projections.
  7. Set Your Desired Annual Retirement Income.
    Input the amount of money you wish to have each year during retirement. This helps the retirement savings calculator determine your savings goal.
  8. Account for Inflation Rate.
    Provide the expected rate of inflation. This helps the retirement savings calculator adjust your savings projections for rising costs.
  9. Input Employer Match.
    Specify the percentage of your contributions that your employer will match. This boosts your savings projections.
  10. Enter Your Tax Rate.
    Provide the percentage of your income that goes to taxes. This helps the retirement savings calculator estimate your net savings.
  11. Calculate Your Retirement Savings.
    Once you have entered all the necessary details, click the “Calculate Retirement Savings” button to see your projected savings growth and retirement income. This calculation helps you plan your financial future effectively.

Retirement Savings Calculator Terms

Current Age

The age you are today. This is a key input for the retirement savings calculator to determine your savings timeline.

Retirement Age

The age at which you plan to retire. This affects the total years of saving and is crucial for the retirement savings calculator.

Current Savings

The total amount of money you have already saved. This helps the retirement savings calculator project future growth.

Annual Contribution

The amount you plan to save each year. This is essential for the retirement savings calculator to estimate your total savings.

Retirement Duration

The number of years you expect to be retired. This optional input helps the retirement savings calculator determine how long your savings need to last.

Post-Retirement Income

Expected income after retirement. Including this helps the retirement savings calculator provide a more accurate projection.

Desired Annual Retirement Income

The amount you wish to have annually during retirement. This helps the retirement savings calculator determine your savings goal.

Inflation Rate

The expected annual increase in the cost of living. This helps the retirement savings calculator adjust for rising expenses.

Employer Match

The percentage of contributions your employer matches. Including this boosts your projected savings.

Tax Rate

The percentage of your income paid in taxes. This helps the retirement savings calculator estimate your net savings.
